title: Messaggi non leggibili o completamente in bianco
content:
Versione 102.11.2 - ID build 20230526152851 Dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento eseguito il 29.05.2023 riscontro (su uno solo dei 4 account usati) i seguenti problemi: - alcuni messaggi ricevuti vengono visualizzati correttamente; - altri messaggi ricevuti, che appaiono nell'elenco con i relativi attributi, non vengono visualizzati (né in anteprima messaggi né aprendo il messaggio); - altri messaggi vengono visualizzati in modo anomalo; segue esempio: --_000_PR3P194MB168444C0CFB9F19AA83C6423DD499PR3P194MB1684EURP_--

--_009_PR3P194MB168444C0CFB9F19AA83C6423DD499PR3P194MB1684EURP_ Content-Type: image/png; name="image001.png" Content-Description: image001.png Content-Disposition: inline; filename="image001.png"; size=2113; creation-date="Thu, 01 Jun 2023 12:38:06 GMT"; modification-date="Thu, 01 Jun 2023 12:38:06 GMT" Content-ID: <image001.png@01D99496.7F0A3180> Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64

iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAADcAAABECAYAAAFSap2/AAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACx jwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAAIdUAACHVAQSctJ0AAAfWSURBVFhH7Zn5bxVVFMf7d4gorkiIaMQtcfmF

Tali problemi si riscontrano anche su messaggi ricevuti precedentemente all'aggiornamento e che venivano visualizzati correttamente.

Chiedo se sia possibile ripristinare la visualizzazione e/o recuperare i messaggi attualmente non fruibili.
creator: lanzi1947

title: openPGP in Thunderbird V.102
content:
I sent an E-mail from my account using Thunderbird 102, signed and with added public key but not encrypted. I inspected this mail in the mail server account of the recipient. It contains two attachments: 1) An openPGP asc file which contains the key ID in the name. When opened it shows my ASCII armoured public key. 2) A .sig file: "OpenPGP_signature.sig" When I inspect the same mail in the Thunderbird program of the recipient, it possesses only the first attachment. The sig file is missing. When I try to decrypt or verify the .sig file using Kleopatra or using GpgEX from the Windows Explorer menu, I get error messages like „Signaturfile invalid“ or „input/output error“.

How can I check the validity of the sig file or better, how can I open it to see the complete clear text and decrypt the encrypted part ?

I would be grateful for infos or links to answer my questions ! Sincerely WW
creator: wolfram.welte

title: Can't dismiss Calendar reminder, or change any of the event settings (Reminders, Delete it, etc.)

title: Attachments are saved with a size of zero
content:
Thunderbird is installed on Windows Server 2016. It is connected via IMAP protocol and has been used for several years, but there is a problem from time to time:

When a user saves an application to the server, the size of their email is 0 bytes, only the title and an empty pdf file are saved.

Is there any way to get rid of this problem? In fact, this application can be opened on another PC, but not on the server via remote desktop.

title: Erro ao Receber Mensagens no Thunderbird
content:
Possuo várias contas de e-mail e somente uma conta ocorre o seguinte erro ao tentar receber mensagens:

Não foi possível escrever o email na caixa de correio. Verifique se você tem privilégios de escrita no sistema de arquivos e há espaço em disco suficiente para copiar a caixa de correio.

Ja desinstalei o thunderbird e instalei novamente e o mesmo erro ocorre. Testei com outras contas de e-mail e nenhuma delas ocorre este erro. O erro ocorre somente com uma conta. Fiz o teste configurando a conta em outros computadores e o erro volta a ocorrer. Alguém sabe me dizer porque isto ocorre somente em 1 conta sendo que possuo mais de 20 hospedadas no mesmo servidor (locaweb)?
creator: financeiro45

I'm a funds contributor, I really love and believe in your product, looking forward to new releases that hopefully have things like centralized configuration/spam filter/email filters.

title: Thunderbird error message  reads "Login to account my.name@btinternet.com failed"
content: Thunderbird error message reads "Login to server mail.btinternet.com with username my.name@btinternet.com failed." After several prompts to Retry/Enter New Password/Cancel, I eventually receive another message "Server mail.btinternet.com has disconnected. The server may have gone down or there may be a network problem." Neither of these are true: I can access the server via webmail (using Firefox) with or without VPN, and my gmail and ionos email accounts are working so it isn't a network problem. I see that the problem has arisen for others, but the responses have all been archived. Any suggestions?
creator: rob.cook1

title: synchronization with yahoo mail
content:
Hello, again I have a synchronization problem with yahoomail.

I have this configuration by default and I receive emails or I can send emails.

The problem arises when moving emails or deleting them from the service provider in TB does not sync properly. When moving or deleting an email from the server, the email takes time to synchronize and one is duplicated, it stays in the inbox and another is created in the folder where it was moved or deleted. This only happens from the provider to TB if I do it from TB the provider updates itself after a while what am I doing wrong? I also attach the default internet configuration that does not give me problems with outlook or zohomail
creator: erik.astudillo

title: Can't send charter.net emails
content:
This is an intermittent problem. Sometimes Thunderbird refuses to send charter.net email. I get this error msg:

Login to server smtp.charter.net with username xxx failed. (xxx is my email address)

Resetting the modem and rebooting the computer don't help. This happens on multiple computers. Changing my Spectrum password doesn't help either. Spectrum support said I need to switch to Gmail or Outlook, which would be a major nuisance.

In a day or two it probably will start working again. Also, it basically never works when I'm traveling. Sending email from the Spectrum website works fine, and I can send from my Android phone no problem. I have Gmail on my android tablet and it can't even search for emails so I have zero confidence in that, plus I have many folders of emails going back 10+ years on Thunderbird which I can't port over to another email program.

I saw the previous conversation blaming the problem on Thunderbird, which isn't helpful.
creator: jmeisner1

title: Recurring tasks
content: I am trying to manage recurring tasks. I entered the monthly recurring task. When I marked it complete in the month of April it did not send another reminder for the month of May and the task shows as completed because I had marked it complete for April. Can I fix this or is it best to set it up as a recurring event. I seem to not have issues with the way events recur. However I would rather keep this under tasks. Would someone have a solution for this. I'd like to mark complete each month and then be reminded the following month again and so forth for each month it is due. I really hope I can enter one task for this rather than 12 separate ones. Thank you.

creator: sitesvisited

title: Microsoft 365 sign in window not appearing properly
content: I am changing the password authentication on two email accounts (two different Windows laptops) from "normal password" to "Oauth". Same version of TBird on each laptop. As the last step in this simple process, a GoDaddy window/web page pops up asking to verify Microsoft365 account credentials. On one laptop (Win7), this window contains a normal display with fields to enter password, etc. I am able to complete the process on this laptop, and it works fine. On the second laptop (Win11), the process is the same, and the same window appears, but it is blank. There are no fields to enter the required data. I've worked on this for a week now, changing default browsers, various settings, and have spent much time on the phone with GoDaddy support, all to no avail. I suspect the problem is in TBird, but I have no idea how to find it. Support for "Normal Password" authentication has been dropped, so this email account will not work until I change authentication to "Oauth". Help.
creator: john919

title: Retrieving my Thunderbird from my dying computer
content:
As a user of TB almost from the beginning, I am now embarrassed to say that my last computer, a MacBook, has been dying, and I didn’t really think or know how to back up my TB. In any case my back up machine fell and got broken and can’t be copied except for $1,500+ !! I have a second hand MacAir coming in two days. I want to be able to get all my TB program onto this MacAir. I still am a volunteer for a 13 year old charity scholarship program in Haiti and although I’m 85, I still have lots of work to do on computer—mainly news letters, and advertising for fundraising. So, if you can help me, I will be most pleased. I did find the YouTube coverage of how to transfer TB from one machine to another. A pro Mac company is going to help me rescue my TB from my dying MacBook and I want to give him all the help he can use. Oh and somehow I never saved my password for Thunderbird, my computer had it saved so I was able to use it. But now, not sure whether my TB on my old MacBook will also have the password saved.????? Many thanks for this and for all the years of providing TB for me!!!!!

Tom Luce [removed emails from public forum] (my two emails, [removed phone# from public forum] [removed full address]
creator: tomfluce
